thread.title: Old Bridge QB Artur Sitkowski is Football Player of the Week
thread.title_full: Old Bridge QB Artur Sitkowski is Football Player of the Week

title: Old Bridge QB Artur Sitkowski is Football Player of the Week
text:
Old Bridge QB Artur Sitkowski is Football Player of the Week Greg Tufaro , @GregTufaro 4:01 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 QB Artur Sitkowski at Old Bridge High School football practice on August 14, 2015. (Photo: Keith A. Muccilli/ Staff) 111 CONNECT 40 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Displaying the poise and leadership of a seasoned veteran, sophomore quarterback Artur Sitkowski engineered one of the best comebacks of the scholastic football season. 
The Old Bridge High School rookie completed 13 of 24 passes for 240 yards and three touchdowns to help the Knights erase a 14-point fourth-quarter deficit in a thrilling 28-21 victory over Sayreville on Friday night. 
For his efforts, Sitkowski has been named the Home News Tribune Football Player of the Week. 
The comeback took place before what Old Bridge head coach Anthony Lanzafama called a “great football environment” and in front of a “great homecoming crowd” at Sayreville’s War Memorial Stadium. 
The turning point of the game took place early in the fourth quarter. 
Facing a fourth-and-11 from the Sayreville 26, Sitkowski threw a laser across the middle of the field on a crossing pattern to Jake Kodros, whose first-down reception set up Nick Sodano’s 2-yard touchdown run that helped the Knights close to 21-14 with 9:09 remaining. 
On Old Bridge’s ensuing possession, Jake Esposito caught a short pass on an out pattern and, after running over a defender, raced down the sideline for a 50-yard touchdown reception that closed the deficit to 21-20 (the Knights missed the extra point). 
Sitkowski struck again with 3:18 left, looking off his primary target to find Anthony Imbimbo for a 40-yard touchdown on a skinny post that produced the final margin. 
Earlier in the game, Sitkowski gave Old Bridge a 7-0 lead with a 24-yard scoring strike to Kodros. 
Sitkowski is one of three starting quarterbacks in the Greater Middlesex Conference – including Bishop Ahr’s Tommy Galante and St. Joseph’s Paul Cocozziello – who were groomed as youth football players in Old Bridge. A fourth product of the feeder system, Imbimbo, is Sitkowski’s backup. 
Galante and Imbimbo played for the now-defunct Old Bridge Knights, while Sitkowski and Cocozziello are products of the Sayrewoods South youth program, according to Lanzafama. 
After Sayreville limited Old Bridge to 63 rushing yards on 27 carries, the Knights needed Sitkowski’s performance to improve to 4-2 overall and 4-1 in the Red Division. 
“Artur is mature and he’s really starting to let the game come to him a little bit,” Lanzafama said. “He was not rattled at all in the game. He was poised and he just took it play-by-play and tried to make the next throw. He makes very good decisions.” 
Sitkowski, who has received scholarship offers from Rutgers and Maryland, has always possessed a strong and accurate arm but is now improving his touch. The 6-foot-4, 205-pound signal caller is surprisingly mobile in the triple-gun. 
“He’s more of a pocket-type kid,” Lanzafama said, “but he can move and buy some time with his feet. He’s a hard worker and wants to be the best he can be. 
“Every day at practice, he’s getting better." 
GMC FOOTBALL WEEK 6 TOP PERFORMERS 
RUSHING
